title: Adult Airway Obstruction - Choking
pcr_text: 45-year-old male clutching throat with hands, unable to speak, cyanotic face. Witness reports he was eating steak when he suddenly started choking.
correct_error: Complete airway obstruction. Perform abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver) per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Perform abdominal thrusts until object is expelled or patient becomes unresponsive

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Blind finger sweep can push object deeper. Abdominal thrusts are first-line for conscious choking victims per 2022 Standards.

title: Pediatric Choking - Infant
pcr_text: 8-month-old infant with poor air exchange, weak cry, and cyanosis. Mother reports infant was eating crackers and suddenly stopped breathing.
correct_error: Partial airway obstruction in infant. Perform back blows and chest thrusts per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.
stress_fto_responses: Don't do abdominal thrusts on infants!

options.text: Perform 5 back blows followed by 5 chest thrusts

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Abdominal thrusts can damage infant organs. Use back blows and chest thrusts per 2022 Standards.

title: Severe Anaphylaxis - Airway Compromise
pcr_text: 28-year-old female with urticaria, facial swelling, stridor, and respiratory distress following bee sting. Patient reports known bee allergy.
correct_error: Anaphylactic airway compromise. Administer epinephrine auto-injector immediately per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer epinephrine auto-injector and provide oxygen
Start IV line for epinephrine infusion
options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! IV access requires AEMT certification. EMT-B uses auto-injectors for anaphylaxis per 2022 Standards.

title: Tension Pneumothorax - Breathing Threat
pcr_text: 35-year-old male with penetrating chest trauma, severe respiratory distress, absent breath sounds on left side, and tracheal deviation to right.
correct_error: Tension pneumothorax. Provide oxygen and transport immediately per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Apply high-flow oxygen and transport immediately

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Needle decompression requires Paramedic certification. EMT-B provides oxygen and transports per 2022 Standards.

title: Acute Asthma - Respiratory Failure
pcr_text: 42-year-old male with severe wheezing, unable to speak in full sentences, using accessory muscles, and oxygen saturation 88% on room air.
correct_error: Acute severe asthma exacerbation. Administer nebulized albuterol per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer nebulized albuterol and supplemental oxygen

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Epinephrine requires assessment for anaphylaxis. Albuterol is first-line for asthma per 2022 Standards.

title: Cardiac Arrest - VF/VT
pcr_text: 62-year-old male unresponsive, pulseless, with witnessed collapse. Bystander CPR in progress for 3 minutes.
correct_error: Cardiac arrest with shockable rhythm. Initiate CPR and apply AED per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Initiate CPR and apply AED immediately

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! IV epinephrine requires Paramedic certification. AED is first intervention for EMT-B per 2022 Standards.

title: Major Hemorrhage - Arterial Bleeding
pcr_text: 25-year-old male with deep laceration to forearm, bright red blood spurting from wound, patient pale and diaphoretic.
correct_error: Arterial hemorrhage. Apply direct pressure and tourniquet if needed per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Apply direct pressure, elevate extremity, and apply tourniquet if bleeding continues

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Ice can worsen bleeding. Direct pressure and tourniquet are indicated per 2022 Standards.

title: Build-a-List: Adult Choking Management
pcr_text: 55-year-old male suddenly clutching throat, unable to speak, turning cyanotic. Witness reports eating food.
correct_error: Order the steps for managing conscious adult choking victim per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: 1. Assess responsiveness, 2. Call for help, 3. Perform abdominal thrusts, 4. Continue until object expelled or unconscious
1. Perform blind finger sweep, 2. Abdominal thrusts, 3. Call for help
options.feedback: INCORRECT ORDER! Assess responsiveness first, then call for help, then abdominal thrusts per 2022 Standards.

options.text: 1. Administer oxygen, 2. Abdominal thrusts, 3. Call for help

title: Build-a-List: Infant Choking Response
pcr_text: 10-month-old infant suddenly stops breathing while eating, poor air exchange, turning blue.
correct_error: Order the steps for infant choking management per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: 1. Support infant, 2. Deliver 5 back blows, 3. Turn over for 5 chest thrusts, 4. Repeat until object expelled
1. Abdominal thrusts, 2. Back blows, 3. Call for help
options.feedback: INCORRECT ORDER! Back blows then chest thrusts for infants per 2022 Standards. No abdominal thrusts.

options.text: 1. Call for help, 2. Abdominal thrusts, 3. Back blows

title: Build-a-List: Anaphylaxis Management
pcr_text: 32-year-old female with sudden hives, swelling, and difficulty breathing after eating shellfish.
correct_error: Order the steps for anaphylaxis management per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: 1. Assess ABCs, 2. Administer epinephrine auto-injector, 3. Provide oxygen, 4. Transport immediately

options.feedback: INCORRECT ORDER! Epinephrine is first-line treatment for anaphylaxis per 2022 Standards.

title: Build-a-List: Cardiac Arrest Management
pcr_text: 70-year-old female found unresponsive and pulseless. No bystander CPR.
correct_error: Order the steps for cardiac arrest management per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: 1. Confirm unresponsiveness, 2. Call for help/activate EMS, 3. Check pulse, 4. Start CPR, 5. Apply AED
1. Apply AED, 2. Check pulse, 3. Start CPR
options.feedback: INCORRECT ORDER! Confirm unresponsiveness and call for help first per 2022 Standards.

options.text: 1. Check pulse, 2. Apply AED, 3. Start CPR

title: Build-a-List: Major Bleeding Control
pcr_text: 40-year-old male with deep laceration to thigh, blood pooling on floor, patient becoming pale.
correct_error: Order the steps for major bleeding control per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: 1. Don PPE, 2. Apply direct pressure, 3. Elevate extremity, 4. Apply tourniquet if needed, 5. Transport

options.feedback: INCORRECT ORDER! Direct pressure is first, tourniquet is last resort per 2022 Standards.

title: Complete Airway Obstruction - Adult
pcr_text: 58-year-old male becomes unresponsive during choking episode. Witness reports steak lodged in throat.
correct_error: Unresponsive choking victim. Begin CPR immediately per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Begin CPR immediately - do not attempt to remove object
Perform blind finger sweep to remove food
options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Blind finger sweep can push object deeper. CPR takes priority per 2022 Standards.

title: Anaphylaxis with Respiratory Arrest
pcr_text: 19-year-old male with severe allergic reaction, unresponsive, no breathing, but has pulse. History of peanut allergy.
correct_error: Anaphylaxis with respiratory arrest. Provide rescue breathing per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Provide rescue breathing and transport immediately

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! EMT-B cannot administer additional epinephrine. Rescue breathing is priority per 2022 Standards.

title: Flail Chest - Paradoxical Breathing
pcr_text: 45-year-old male with MVC injury showing paradoxical chest movement, severe pain, and shortness of breath.
correct_error: Flail chest with impaired breathing. Provide oxygen and pain management per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer high-flow oxygen and manage pain if possible

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Needle decompression requires Paramedic certification. Oxygen is primary treatment per 2022 Standards.

title: Pulmonary Edema - Respiratory Distress
pcr_text: 68-year-old male with severe shortness of breath, pink frothy sputum, and bilateral crackles. History of CHF.
correct_error: Acute pulmonary edema. Provide oxygen and transport in upright position per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer high-flow oxygen and position upright

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Nitroglycerin requires Paramedic certification. Oxygen is EMT-B intervention per 2022 Standards.

title: Cardiac Arrest - Asystole
pcr_text: 75-year-old female found unresponsive, pulseless, apneic. CPR in progress for 10 minutes.
correct_error: Asystolic cardiac arrest. Continue CPR per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Continue CPR and transport if indicated

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! IV epinephrine requires Paramedic certification. EMT-B continues CPR per 2022 Standards.

title: Exsanguinating Hemorrhage
pcr_text: 30-year-old male with amputated finger, blood spurting from wound, patient in shock.
correct_error: Exsanguinating hemorrhage. Apply tourniquet immediately per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: INSUFFICIENT! Spurting blood requires tourniquet per 2022 Standards for severe hemorrhage.

title: Build-a-List: Severe Asthma Management
pcr_text: 35-year-old female with status asthmaticus, unable to speak, oxygen saturation 85%, using all accessory muscles.
correct_error: Order the steps for severe asthma management per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: 1. Assess ABCs, 2. Administer nebulized albuterol, 3. Provide high-flow oxygen, 4. Transport immediately

options.feedback: INCORRECT ORDER! Albuterol is first-line for asthma per 2022 Standards.

title: Build-a-List: Hemorrhage Control Sequence
pcr_text: 50-year-old male with gunshot wound to leg, severe bleeding, patient pale and tachycardic.
correct_error: Order the steps for hemorrhage control per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: 1. Ensure scene safety, 2. Don PPE, 3. Apply direct pressure, 4. Elevate if possible, 5. Tourniquet if bleeding continues

options.feedback: INCORRECT ORDER! Scene safety and PPE first, then direct pressure per 2022 Standards.

title: Foreign Body Airway - Child
pcr_text: 6-year-old child suddenly collapses during play, unresponsive, no breathing. Witness reports child was eating candy.
correct_error: Foreign body airway obstruction in unresponsive child. Begin CPR per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Abdominal thrusts for unresponsive patients. CPR is indicated per 2022 Standards.

title: Tension Pneumothorax Progression
pcr_text: 28-year-old male stabbed in chest, initially stable but now with severe respiratory distress, absent breath sounds right side, jugular venous distension.
correct_error: Progressing tension pneumothorax. Provide oxygen and transport urgently per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Apply high-flow oxygen and transport immediately

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Needle decompression requires Paramedic certification. Oxygen and transport priority per 2022 Standards.
